title: Star Trek DDK Cuts
description:
The DDK Fan edits of the four included Star Trek Films are a labour of love.

Created primarily for personal enjoyment, they are the versions of these great movies I always wanted.

The included DDK Cut versions of these films are the only Star Trek Fan edits I have produced. I do not have issues with the others that significantly warrant creating Fan edits.


Using a base of the modern releases of these films, the DDK cuts represent the versions of these wonderful films that I feel represent the best possible representations of each film.

Each have have numerous additions, removals, tweaks, colour corrections and minor to major special effects changes.
-
Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country contains minor colour correction, minor effects tweaks and the replacement of the CGI Enterprise shot during the final battle.
Most significantly, Phasers have been added to the Enterprise and Excelsior during the final battle.

-
Star Trek VII: Generations contains colour and gamma correction, musical enhancements and levelling, as well as a new prologue acting as a bridge between the TOS and TNG eras.
Most significantly, the controversially re-used shots from Star Trek VI have been replaced with new shots: The Enterprise B is now properly shown at warp instead of the re-used Excelsior shot,
and the destruction of the Duras Sisters' Bird of Prey is shown in a newly composed shot.
Additional low quality/re-used shots have been replaced (for example, the Enterprise flyover shot before the Stellar Cartography scene)

-
Star Trek IX: Insurrection has heavy re-compositing and colour correction on every external/CG/space shot in the film.
The previously slightly 'flat' or 'unfinished' look of many of the film's space scenes has been fixed.
The poorly animated 'face stretching' shot has been cut off early and the scene has been re-editing. Implying more of the effect than showing it.
The Son'a stunt man on-board the Holoship is no longer shown performing a hammy death. The scene has been re-edited to only use the best part of the stunt.
The final scene on-board the Son'a Collector vessel has been completely re-composited. The original scene was left unfinished due to the film going over budget; with unfinished Blue-screen shots.
These blue-screen elements have been converted to create a much more subdued interior appearance on-board the Collector.

-
Star Trek X: Nemesis has had removals and slight editing changes.
The controversial 'car chase' has been completely removed, with an elegant, subtle scene change instead.
The Enterprise shots going into Warp have been re-composited, creating a much more aggressive, rapid effect.
The fight between Riker and Shinzon's Viceroy has been reduced and abbreviated.

It is my desire that these versions of these beloved films be enjoyed by all Star Trek fans.
Additionally, it is my hope that these cuts of the films may sway opinion from negative to positive for some fans, as I am confident their major issues with the films will be resolved.

Some Screenshots: <a href="
http://imgur.com/a/iCAZG" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://imgur.com/a/iCAZG</a>


These cuts are in 1920X1080 Resolution and Stereo audio, and I recommend watching them using Neo 6 Cinema if you have a surround sound system.

It goes without saying but make sure you have full 0-255 RGB on your display.

You must own legal copies of each film on Bluray to enjoy these fan edits.
These fan edits are produced and distributed under the Creative Commons License and are not for profit in any way.	

Thank you, enjoy, and please Seed!
